references.reason: This paper is foundational for understanding and evaluating generative adversarial networks (GANs), a crucial element in many virtual try-on methods.

references.paper_title: Openpose: Realtime multi-person 2D pose estimation using part affinity fields
references.reason: Openpose provides accurate and efficient human pose estimation, critical for aligning virtual garments to people in virtual try-on applications.

references.paper_title: Quo vadis, action recognition? A new model and the Kinetics dataset
references.reason: The Kinetics dataset is a large-scale video dataset used for training video models, significant for video-based virtual try-on.

references.paper_title: StableVideo: Text-driven consistency-aware diffusion video editing
references.reason: This paper introduces a diffusion model for high-quality video generation, which is directly relevant to the video-based virtual try-on task.
This work provides a scalable diffusion model framework using transformers, directly used as the backbone in this paper's proposed method.
